arts.ttl: Sources: Lyon attempting highly controversial Crystal Palace transfer
arts.sum: Crystal Palace’s star player, Jean-Philippe Mateta, is the subject of a hugely controversial bid by Lyon, thanks to John Textor, who owns a stake in both clubs. It’s controversial because, as of this moment, the Ligue 1 side – owned by Textor – have been banned from signing players because of their dire financial situation, […] The post Sources: Lyon attempting highly controversial Crystal Palace transfer appeared first on CaughtOffside.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner sends message to Millwall as Crystal Palace boss hails Adam Wharton
arts.sum: Ben Chilwell and Matheus Franca also feature in FA Cup win at Doncaster in boost for Eagles

arts.ttl: In it to win it: Oliver Glasner says Crystal Palace mean business in the FA Cup
arts.sum: The Eagles avoided an upset at the Eco-Power Stadium to set up a home tie against Millwall in the last 16.

arts.ttl: Munoz & Devenny fire Palace past Doncaster
arts.sum: Crystal Palace progress to the fifth round of the FA Cup after their 2-0 away win over Doncaster Rovers at the Eco-Power Stadium.

arts.ttl: Palace beat Doncaster to set up FA Cup meeting with Millwall
arts.sum: Goals from Daniel Munoz and Justin Devenny saw Crystal Palace through to the FA Cup fifth round with a 2-0 win at Doncaster.

arts.ttl: Devenny downs Doncaster as Crystal Palace sail through to FA Cup fifth round
arts.athr: Aaron Bower at the Eco-Power Stadium
arts.sum: With the wind swirling, the rain beating down and an opposition brimming with confidence and roared on by a full house, this had all the hallmarks of a tricky evening in the FA Cup for Crystal Palace. But it is perhaps testament to the turnaround in Palace’s season that Oliver Glasner’s side navigated this test fairly routinely, albeit not without a spirited showing from Doncaster Rovers, who can exit the cup with their heads held high. Their attention now turns to pushing for promotion from League Two after Palace set up a mouthwatering south London derby with Millwall in the fifth round. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Doncaster 0-2 Crystal Palace: Justin Devenny scores Eagles tee up Millwall clash with FA Cup win
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner able to make changes as Adam Wharton and Ben Chilwell feature

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace win at Doncaster to set up fifth round tie against Millwall
arts.sum: The Eagles avoided an upset to set up a home tie against the Premier League team.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace win at Doncaster to set up fifth round tie against Millwall
arts.sum: The Eagles avoided an upset to set up a home tie against the Premier League team.

arts.ttl: 'Glorious finish' - Devenny scores his first goal for Palace
arts.sum: Justin Devenny scores his first Crystal Palace goal as the Premier League side double their lead against Doncaster in the fourth round of the FA Cup.
